turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: You know, on an empty road where you know it's safe and nobody's around...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I'm not sure... I might have.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Well,  let's say your mother was in the car and you had to get her to a hospital.  You'd do it then for sure wouldn't you?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Well... I gues I would... Yeah.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Now,  let's say the whole country. Was in that car.   The entire United States of America.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Now some of this may feel a bit Strange at first.  You gotta remember that even a professional Politician has Some trouble getting used to...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: The teleprompter.  Is it hooked up?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Right.  Now whenever he stands at a Podium, the President always puts one hand in the pocket of his coat...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: That's at a press conference. Otherwise he just puts `em right out there.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: ... Somewhere there is a distant light, guiding us through this rocky shoal...'

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: 'America isn't in what we say here tonight -- it's in the faces and the smiles of a Sunday afternoon...'  Hand on the heart...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: '... It's in the gentle kindness of the family kitchen as we gather together when the sun goes down...'

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I thought you said I wasn't going to see her.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: It's just five minutes.  She comes in. You wave to the press. She leaves.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Yeah, but the First Lady... Couldn't we start with a cousin or something?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: She hardly ever sees him and it'll be so fast, she won't have a chance to tell.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Dave, the budget's a very complicated thing.  Even I don't understand it sometimes.  Now occasionally we have to make some cuts and...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: But we went there.  We saw those kids.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Let's call it a night.   I can't take any more.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Right.  We can pick up on the rest tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: What do you mean you made it all up?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We had to, Dave. The guy's a choir boy.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Oh, I know, I know... It looks awfully bad.  It's really embarrassing.  But it was Bob's idea.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Absolutely.  Well, that might be kind of tough. Once the press starts smelling blood...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Now he's making stuff up about me.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You're spending forty-three million dollars on an ad campaign to...  'Boost consumer confidence in the American auto industry.'

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Does it make the cars any better?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY OF COMMERCE
turns.text: No,  sir.  It's more of a perceptual issue.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY OF COMMERCE
turns.text: Yes, it's designed to bolster individual confidence in a previous domestic automotive purchase.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY OF COMMERCE
turns.text: Well... to shore up product identification and preserve market share.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: So we're spending forty-seven million dollars to make people feel better about a car they've already bought?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Well I'm sure that's really important, but I don't want to tell some eight- year-old kid he has to sleep in the street because we want people to feel better about their cars.  Do you want to tell him that?

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: This is from the people of Burundi...

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: And these are a gift from the King of To go.

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: Mr. President, may I speak frankly with you?

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: Oh, come on, we're not children.  I didn't have anything to do with this Fidelity nonsense and you know it.

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: All I've got is my integrity.  That's all I have.  Now I don't know why you turned your attack dogs on me.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: They re not my attack dogs.

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: He's not gonna win -- not in the end... They never do.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You ever think back to how you started.

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: One day my wife says to me 'Why don't you try running for office.  You talk about it all the time, why don't you just do it?'  So I tell my boss I have a dentist appointment and I go down to the registrar of voters on my lunch break.  Next thing I know, I'm a councilman.

turns.speaker: NANCE
turns.text: My wife was my campaign manager. We had a two thousand dollar budget.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Oh my God...  I thought it was a legitimate deduction, I swear to God. See... I need a piano for my work sometimes...

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: Mr. Kovic.   We're not here about your taxes.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: On occasion for security purposes, to double for the President at the Secret Service hires someone public functions and exposed situations.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: So, how long have they been like that - - you know, him and the First Lady?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You mean you don't know or like -- you can't say.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: So you just protect the President the whole time?   That's your whole job?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Huh.  You know what I always wondered the way they say you guys'd take a bullet for the President.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Well, is that really true? I mean, would you really get killed just to save his life.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Call Bob and Reed.  Tell them I need them immediately.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I was waiting for that jack.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: You mean with you and everything?

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: First thing they teach you at the academy.  `Don't give me gold and silver, or other worldly things, just the pride and glory of bleeding for my King.'

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: But Bill was your king, not Bob.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: Yeah, but Bob found me when I was stuck in Firearms and Tobacco...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Didn't mean to bum you out.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: That's okay.  You alright down here by yourself?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Oh, sure.  Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Oh... right...  You know, ever since the stroke...

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: You sure you don't want a lift back home?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: No thanks.  It's not that far.

turns.speaker: DUANE
turns.text: I would have taken a bullet for I you, Dave.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Don't you have anything to say to me?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You don't change, do you, Bill?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Since when do you care about the homeless?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm sure it's keeping you up nights.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Oh, come on, Bill.  Don't patronize me.   I'm not one of your little...  Turn around.  I'm talking to you!... Turnaround!

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: ... You know, if you want to be the same old bastard, that's fine.  I can handle it.   But don't pull this 'man of the people' bullshit and then do something like this.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: That's not just a works bill you vetoed -- that would have given these kids homes...  ... When I think about that little spectacle you pulled with those muppets and that magic trick...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: What's wrong with a magic trick?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Look.  If there was some mistake...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: There's no mistake, Bill.   If you veto their funding, it's not a mistake. If you hurt someone intentionally, it's not a mistake.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I saw the light.  I thought maybe you were up.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: That was quite a thing you did today.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Oh, I don't think so.  Still, you helped a lot of people.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Kind of reminds me of that thing you did back in the state legislature.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You weren't in the state legislature.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I mean, what is it?  Another Secretary? A jaunt to the Bahamas with Some 'campaign worker.'  Where is he?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: When were you all planning to tell me? A year from now?   After the election...  What's going on here? Dave hesitates.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I'm sure they did.  'State of Emergency.'  'National Security.' You ever hear of the Constitution?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I'm not the First Lady, anymore.  I shouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Oh, they didn't brief you on that? How sloppy of them.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I never wanted to hurt anybody.  In fact... I even thought I was helping.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: How were you gonna get home?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I hadn't thought it out that far.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Truman used it all the time.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You don't have to keep walking with me.   I'm okay from here.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: He said he'll pick it up in a couple of days.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I lock at you and I see Bill...  I mean, he's almost dead, but he's right here... I mean, you're right here... alive and...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: In fact,  I'm not anything like him and... I guess I want you to know that.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: He wasn't always like that, anyway.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I'm starving.   There's got to be something open around here.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I really don't have much of an appetite.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You have a lot of secrets.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: So what do you do the rest of the time?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You mean when I'm not running the country?

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: It's just more than anybody else does around here.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Well don't get carried away -- I'm not that good at it.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: You know, Dave -- it is Dave, isn't it?  I can't keep all of this a secret.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: But you could go to jail for it.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I mean, I want to... I just, I feel strange...

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Looks like we're not going to get a chance to get much done.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Yeah, but we got a little bit done. And if you do a little and I do a little... then maybe the next guy'll do a little...

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Yeah.  And it's better than not believing it Their faces are inches apart.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: I sure fall for some weird guys.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: ) Thought I needed a little change.  You like it?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I saw you on T.V... at his funeral.

turns.speaker: ELLEN
turns.text: Oh... I lived with a President.  It isn't any fun.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I wish I had better news... Our compassion index is off seven points from the last sample and that's down eighteen on the year.  The `Cares About People Like Me' numbers are really in the toilet.  We're off twenty points from March and that was right after we raised interest rates...

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Dammit...  I told them no mayo.  See - - I could veto this Simpson Garner thing, but I really don't want to do that...

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Uh, yes, sir.  The Monroe Hotel...

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Did you get someone to double for me there, out front?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Try to find someone who looks like me this time.  That last guy was a joke.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: It'll be on the teleprompter with the rest of the speech.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: It better be.   Last time you had me introduce a dead guy.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Father Mclntire.   He blessed you at the inauguration.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Oh yeah.  Did you take care of later on?

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Maybe. We'll have a little talk first. Then....maybe...I can help you out. String him up.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: And if I don't? If I don't you'll come back after your death. You'll come back and find yourself hanging there...wanting to eat...needing to eat human flesh. You hate that thought, don't you? That's the ultimate sin for most of you fools, isn't it?

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: After hanging up there a few days you will be mad for food...crazed! You will lust for it! YOU WILL BE WORSE THAN ANY OF THEM!

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: NO...NOOOOOOO...SHOOT ME! SHOOT ME! SHOOOOOOOOOT MEEEEEEEEE!!!

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: I'll bargain with you. How many of you are on the island?

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: Two of us...only two of us...me...and him.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: I don't believe you, rebel. Where are your headquarters? On the mainland?

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: The mainland...is dead...a dead place...nobody there...

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Where are your headquarters, rebel? Tell me or I'll let you hang there forever...FOREVER!

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: There are no...headquarters. There are no...rebels. Only the walking dead. Don't you see. They have won.

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: Then why did you come here?

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: To look...look for a place...a place to live in...an empty place...a... new...place...

turns.speaker: RHODES
turns.text: How did you know we were on this island? Do others know? Will others come?

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: Nooooo. Believe me. There are no others...no rebels...nobody...it's over...it's ooooo....

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Help me get him to the boat.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: No. I didn't stop the infection in time. I know.  Don't worry. When he dies, I won't be like Maria. I'll shoot him.

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: I dunno. Landing pad for a helicopter? I dunno.

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: It's some kind of....elevator. There must be something under the ground here....maybe....military.

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: What do we do? Let'em know we're here....or what?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Let's just....wait a minute. Get a better look.

turns.speaker: CHICO
turns.text: It can't be. Are we truly in hell?

turns.speaker: DIESEL
turns.text: Are you alright, Doc? You look... you look real bad.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I have looked bad for four years. Everyone in the world has looked bad for four years. Thank God looks don't matter as much as they once did.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I know it hurts. But it won't be long. Then all the pain will be over. Oh, I wish you could hear me. GOD, GIVE HER THE EARS TO HEAR ME SO SHE KNOWS I DON'T WANT HER TO HURT SO!

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Oh, yes. Quiet. Yes. We must be quiet.

turns.speaker: DIESEL
turns.text: You'd hold us back. We have to go on.
